meanings.definition: To attack by diving from a height
meanings.sent1: The hawk divebombed the mouse in the field.
meanings.sent2: The fighter jet divebombed the enemy target during the mission.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull divebombed the picnic, stealing a sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting a new business divebombed into her mind suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the scary movie divebombed into his thoughts at night.

meanings.sent1: The roller coaster divebombed down the track with thrilling speed.
meanings.sent2: The stock prices divebombed after the negative news was released.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel divebombed from the tree to grab the nut before the others.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it divebombed into her stomach when she saw the spider.
meanings.sent5: The temperature divebombed as the sun set behind the mountains.

meanings.definition: A sudden and aggressive attack from above
meanings.sent1: The divebombed strike from the eagle caught the fish by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The divebombed of enemy planes caused chaos in the city.
meanings.sent3: The divebombed of snowballs from the kids covered the car in white.
meanings.sent4: The divebombed of emails flooded her inbox all at once.
meanings.sent5: The divebombed of questions from the reporters overwhelmed the politician.
